abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated unsatisfactory, and
            sustainability is unlikely. The Bank performance was
            unsatisfactory, partly due to the high turnover of project
            coordinators; mostly, because of failure to correct major
            deficiencies in financial, and institutional management.
            Most significant, were the supervision deficiencies in
            procurement, revealing non-compliance with procurement
            practices, and inadequate contract management, and awards.
            Similarly, the lack of critical attention by the Borrower,
            in monitoring financial management, coupled with poor
            inter-governmental communication, was conducive to an
            unsatisfactory performance. The lessons highlight the fact
            that major deficiencies in performance regarding financial
            management, and procurement, stem from the lack of rigorous
            selection practices, indicating it is imperative to appoint
            staff with excellent track record in financial management,
            and procurement. Likewise, the deficient performance of the
            financial consultant - who also performed as the
            implementing agency project manager - indicate not only the
            need to ensure financial management capability, but identify
            the function as uniquely one. Furthermore, the premature
            lack of counterpart funds, suggest the need for long-term
            resource mobilization, and allocation strategies for
            agricultural research, and development projects, including
            as well, diversification of funding sources.

18154330.theme: Other rural development,Education for the knowledge economy

abstracts.cdata!:
This project has two main components.
            The first focusses on research system development which
            includes:  (a) operating the National Advisory Committee for
            Agricultural Research (NACAR) as an independent advisory
            body to the Federal Ministry of Science and Technology
            (FMST); (b) strengthening of the Agricultural Sciences
            Department of the FMST; (c) preparation of a medium- to
            long-term rolling National Agricultural Research Strategy
            Plan (NRSP); (d) establishment of a research grant scheme to
            fund priority research in which all qualified Nigerian
            institutions could participate; (e) establishment of a
            systematic human resource development program; and (f)
            provision of technical assistance to upgrade research and
            financial management systems, and to develop the NRSP.  The
            second component will strengthen the national agricultural
            research institutes and includes:  (a) rehabilitation of
            infrastructure and repair or purchase of equipment and
            machinery considered essential for implementing agreed
            priority programs; (b) funding for priority research
            programs; (c) research-extension linkage program; and (d)
            support for regional and international research collaboration.
